00014 /**
00015  * @brief an entry in double linked list; 
00016  * If the user wants to link his struct(ure) into a DLIST linked list, then he must embed a DLIST_entry into his structure.
00017  * Access to user defined structure is via embedded SLIST_entry.
00018  */
00019 typedef struct tagDLIST_entry 
00020 {
00021   struct tagDLIST_entry *next,*prev;
00022 }  
00023   DLIST_entry;
00024 
00025 
00026 /**
00027  * @brief Double linked list data structure; where each list element can be of different length. Each element has a pointer to the next and previous element of the list.
00028  *
00029  * This double linked list has a list header (DLIST).
00030  * The list header points to the first and last element in the list.
00031  * first elements previous pointer is NULL; last elements next pointer is NULL
00032  *
00033  * Usage: If the user wants to link his struct(ure) into a list, then he must embed a DLIST_entry into his structure.
00034  * Access to user defined structure is via embedded DLIST_entry.
00035  *
00036  * The list header contains a counter of elements (feature can be surpressed by defining #define DLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00037  */
00038 typedef struct {
00039         size_t elmcount;   /** number of elements in list */ 
00040         DLIST_entry root; /** root.next - pointer to first element, root.last pointer to last element */
00041 } DLIST;
00042 
00043 
00044 typedef void     (*DLIST_VISITOR_V)(DLIST *list, DLIST_entry *entry, void *context);
00045 typedef int32_t  (*DLIST_VISITOR)  (DLIST *list, DLIST_entry *entry, void *context);
00046 typedef int32_t  (*DLIST_COMPARE)  (DLIST_entry *,  DLIST_entry * );
00047 
00048 
00049 /**
00050  * @brief initialises an empty list head
00051  * @param head (in) list head 
00052  */
00053 M_INLINE void DLIST_init( DLIST *head ) 
00054 { 
00055   head->root.next = head->root.prev = 0; 
00056   head->elmcount = 0;
00057 }
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * @brief checks if argument list is empty
00061  * @param list pointer to list.
00062  * @returns not zero for non empty list.
00063  */
00064 M_INLINE int DLIST_isempty( DLIST *head ) 
00065 {
00066   return head->root.next == 0;
00067 }
00068 
00069 /**
00070  * @brief insert new entry before a given entry.
00071  * @param list     (in|out) pointer to list head
00072  * @param pos      (in) current position (newentry inserted after this one).
00073  * @param newentry (in) pointer to new list entry (to be inserted).
00074  */
00075 M_INLINE int DLIST_insert_before( DLIST *list, DLIST_entry *pos, DLIST_entry *newentry) 
00076 {
00077         if (list->root.next) {
00078         
00079                 if (!pos) {
00080                         return -1;
00081                 }
00082 
00083                 newentry->prev = pos->prev;
00084                 pos->prev = newentry;
00085                 newentry->next = pos;
00086 
00087                 if (newentry->prev) {
00088                         newentry->prev->next = newentry;
00089                 }
00090 
00091                 if (list->root.prev == pos) {
00092                         list->root.prev = newentry;
00093                 }
00094 
00095 
00096         } else {
00097 
00098                 list->root.next = list->root.prev = newentry;
00099                 newentry->next = newentry->prev = 0;
00100 
00101         }       
00102 
00103         list->elmcount ++;
00104         return 0;
00105 }
00106 
00107 
00108 /**
00109  * @brief insert new entry after a given entry.
00110  * @param list     (in) pointer to list head
00111  * @param pos      (in) current position (newentry inserted after this one).
00112  * @param newentry (in) pointer to new list entry (to be inserted).
00113  */
00114 M_INLINE void DLIST_insert_after( DLIST *list, DLIST_entry *pos, DLIST_entry *newentry) 
00115 {
00116         if (list->root.next) {
00117                 newentry->next = pos->next;
00118                 pos->next = newentry;
00119                 newentry->prev = pos;
00120 
00121                 if (newentry->next) {
00122                         newentry->next->prev = newentry;
00123                 }
00124 
00125                 if (list->root.next == pos) {
00126                         list->root.next = newentry;
00127                 }
00128 
00129 
00130         } else {
00131 
00132                 list->root.next = list->root.prev = newentry;
00133                 newentry->next = newentry->prev = 0;            
00134 
00135         }
00136 
00137 
00138         list->elmcount ++;
00139 }
00140 
00141 
00142 /**
00143  * @brief delete an element from a list.
00144  * @param list (in|out) the object
00145  * @param link (in) deletes this list element
00146  */
00147 M_INLINE DLIST_entry *DLIST_unlink( DLIST *list, DLIST_entry *link ) 
00148 {
00149         DLIST_entry *next,*prev;
00150 
00151         next = link->next;
00152         prev = link->prev;
00153 
00154         if (next) {
00155                 next->prev = link->prev;
00156         }
00157         if (prev) {
00158                 prev->next = link->next;
00159         }
00160 
00161         if (list->root.next == link) {
00162                 list->root.next = prev; 
00163         }
00164         
00165         if (list->root.prev == link) {
00166                 list->root.prev = next;
00167         }
00168 
00169         link->prev = link->next = 0;
00170 
00171         list->elmcount --;
00172         return link;
00173 }
00174

00176 /**
00177  * @brief insert element as last in list (used to maintain queue)
00178  * @param list list head.
00179  * @param newentry entry to be inserted into list
00180  */
00181 M_INLINE void DLIST_push_back( DLIST *list, DLIST_entry *newentry)
00182 {
00183   DLIST_insert_after( list, list->root.next, newentry );
00184 }
00185 
00186 /**
00187  * @brief insert element as first in list (used to maintain queue)
00188  * @param list (in) list head.
00189  * @param newentry (in) entry to be inserted into list
00190  */
00191 M_INLINE void DLIST_push_front( DLIST *list, DLIST_entry *newentry)
00192 {
00193   DLIST_insert_before( list, list->root.prev, newentry );
00194 }
00195 
00196 /**
00197  * @brief remove the first element from list (used to maintain double ended queue)
00198  * @param list (in) the object
00199  * @return the first element of list, NULL if list empty
00200  */
00201 M_INLINE DLIST_entry * DLIST_pop_front( DLIST *list )
00202 {
00203   DLIST_entry *ret;
00204 
00205   if (DLIST_isempty( list )) {
00206     return 0;
00207   }
00208   ret = list->root.prev;
00209   DLIST_unlink(list, ret);
00210   return ret;  
00211 }
00212 
00213 
00214 /**
00215  * @brief remove the last element from list (used to maintain double ended queue)
00216  * @param list (in) the object
00217  * @return the first element of list, NULL if list empty
00218  */
00219 M_INLINE DLIST_entry * DLIST_pop_back( DLIST *list)
00220 { 
00221   DLIST_entry *ret;
00222 
00223   if (DLIST_isempty( list )) {
00224     return 0;
00225   }
00226   ret = list->root.next;
00227   DLIST_unlink(list, ret);
00228   return ret;
00229 }

00232 M_INLINE DLIST_entry *DLIST_get_first(DLIST *list)
00233 {
00234   if (DLIST_isempty(list)) {
00235     return 0;
00236   }  
00237   return list->root.prev;
00238 }
00239 
00240 M_INLINE DLIST_entry *DLIST_get_last(DLIST *list)
00241 {
00242   if (DLIST_isempty(list)) {
00243     return 0;
00244   }
00245   return list->root.next;
00246 }
00247 
00248 M_INLINE DLIST_entry *DLIST_get_next( DLIST_entry *cur) 
00249 {
00250   return cur->next;
00251 }
00252 
00253 
00254 M_INLINE DLIST_entry *DLIST_get_prev( DLIST_entry *cur ) 
00255 {
00256   return cur->prev;
00257 }

00259 /**
00260  * @brief Macro for iterate over all elements of a list, the list is traversed in forward direction from first element to the last element.
00261  * @param loopvarname (type DLIST_entry *) pointer to the current element
00262  * @param list (type DLIST *) pointer to the list that is traversed
00263  */
00264 #define DLIST_FOREACH( loopvarname, list )\
00265   for((loopvarname) = (list)->root.prev;\
00266       (loopvarname) != 0;\
00267       (loopvarname) = (loopvarname)->next )
00268 
00269 /**
00270  * @brief Macro for iterate over all elements of a list, the list is traversed in reverse direction from last element to the first element.
00271  * @param loopvarname (type DLIST_entry *) pointer to the current element
00272  * @param list (type DLIST *) pointer to the list that is traversed
00273  */
00274 #define DLIST_FOREACH_REVERSE( loopvarname, list )\
00275   for((loopvarname) = (list)->root.next;\
00276       (loopvarname) != 0;\
00277       (loopvarname) = (loopvarname)->prev )
00278 
00279 /**
00280  * @brief Macro for iterate over all elements of a list, You may delete the current element; the list is traversed in forward direction from first element to the last element.
00281  * @param loopvarname (type DLIST_entry *) pointer to the current element
00282  * @param loopvarnamenext (type DLIST_entry *) do not modify! pointer to next element after current element (used for iteration).
00283  * @param list (type DLIST *) pointer to the list that is traversed
00284  */
00285 #define DLIST_FOREACH_SAVE( loopvarname, loopvarnext, list )\
00286   for((loopvarname) = (list)->root.prev, (loopvarnext) = (loopvarname) ? (loopvarname)->next : 0;\
00287       (loopvarname) != 0;\
00288       (loopvarname) = (loopvarnext), (loopvarnext) = (loopvarname) ? (loopvarname)->next : 0)
00289 
00290 /**
00291  * @brief Macro for iterate over all elements of a list, You may delete the current element; the list is traversed in reverse direction from last element to the first element.
00292  * @param loopvarname (type DLIST_entry *) pointer to the current element
00293  * @param loopvarnamenext (type DLIST_entry *) do not modify! pointer to next element after current element (used for iteration).
00294  * @param list (type DLIST *) pointer to the list that is traversed
00295  */
00296 #define DLIST_FOREACH_REVERSE_SAVE( loopvarname, loopvarnext, list )\
00297   for((loopvarname) = (list)->root.next, (loopvarnext) = (loopvarname) ? (loopvarname)->prev : 0;\
00298       (loopvarname) != 0;\
00299       (loopvarname) = (loopvarnext), (loopvarnext) = (loopvarname) ? (loopvarname)->prev : 0)
00300

00303 /*
00304  * @brief: return number of elements in list
00305  * if we don't have element count in list (DLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT defined), then the whole list structure is traversed.
00306  */
00307 M_INLINE size_t DLIST_size( DLIST *list )
00308 {
00309         return list->elmcount;
00310 }
00311 
00312 /*
00313  * @brief get the nth element of a list as counted from the beginning of the list.
00314  * @brief list (IN) the object
00315  * @brief nth  (IN) index of element to retrieve (null based).
00316  */
00317 M_INLINE DLIST_entry *DLIST_get_nth( DLIST *list, size_t nth)
00318 {
00319         DLIST_entry *elm;
00320 
00321         if (nth >= list->elmcount) {
00322                 return 0;
00323         }
00324 
00325         /* if less then half of count - iterate from start of list, otherwise from tail. */
00326         if (nth < (list->elmcount >> 1)) {
00327                 for(elm = DLIST_get_first(list); nth > 0; nth -= 1, elm = DLIST_get_next(elm)); 
00328         } else {
00329                 nth = list->elmcount - nth - 1;
00330                 for(elm = DLIST_get_last(list);  nth > 0; nth -= 1, elm = DLIST_get_prev(elm)); 
00331         }
00332 
00333         return elm;
00334 }
00335 
00336 /*
00337  * @brief get the nth element of a list as counted from the end of the list.
00338  * @brief list (IN) the object
00339  * @brief nth  (IN) index of element to retrieve (null based).
00340  */
00341 M_INLINE DLIST_entry *DLIST_get_nth_reverse( DLIST *list, size_t nth)
00342 {       
00343         return DLIST_get_nth( list, DLIST_size( list ) - nth );
00344 }
00345 
00346 /**
00347  * @brief iterate over all elements of a list, callback is invoked for either element of the list. list is traversed from first element to the last element.
00348  * @param lst (in) the object.
00349  * @param eval (in) callback that is called to visit each set (or cleared) bit.
00350  * @param context (in) pointer that is passed as context on each invocation of callback.
00351  * @param save_from_del (in) if non zero then callback can remove the current link from the list (a bit slower); if null then not; if zero then can't remove the current link from the list.
00352  */
00353 M_INLINE void DLIST_foreach( DLIST *lst, DLIST_VISITOR_V eval, void *context, int save_from_del)
00354 {
00355     DLIST_entry *cur, *next;
00356 
00357         if (!eval) {
00358           return;
00359         }
00360 
00361         if (save_from_del) {
00362                 DLIST_FOREACH_SAVE( cur, next, lst) {
00363                         eval( lst, cur, context );
00364                 }
00365         } else {
00366                 DLIST_FOREACH(  cur, lst ) {
00367                         eval( lst, cur, context );
00368                 }
00369         }               
00370 }
00371 
00372 /**
00373  * @brief iterate over all elements of a list, callback is invoked for either element of the list. list is traversed backword from last element to the first element.
00374  *
00375  * @param lst (in) the object.
00376  * @param eval (in) callback that is called to visit each set (or cleared) bit.
00377  * @param context (in) pointer that is passed as context on each invocation of callback.
00378  * @param save_from_del (in) if non zero then callback can remove the current link from the list (a bit slower); if null then not; if zero then can't remove the current link from the list.
00379  */
00380 M_INLINE void DLIST_foreach_reverse( DLIST *lst, DLIST_VISITOR_V eval, void *context, int save_from_delete)
00381 {
00382         DLIST_entry *cur, *next;
00383 
00384         if (!eval) {
00385           return ;
00386         }
00387 
00388         if ( save_from_delete ) {
00389                 DLIST_FOREACH_REVERSE_SAVE( cur, next, lst ) {
00390                         eval( lst, cur, context );
00391                 }
00392         } else {
00393                 DLIST_FOREACH_REVERSE( cur, lst ) {
00394                         eval( lst, cur, context );
00395                 }
00396         }
00397 }

00401 /**
00402  * @brief find an element within the linked list. callback is invoked for each element of the list, in forward direction from first element to last element; when the callback returns non zero value the iteration stops as we have found what we searched for.
00403  * 
00404  * @param lst (in) the object.
00405  * @param eval (in) callback that is called to visit each set (or cleared) bit.
00406  * @param context (in) pointer that is passed as context on each invocation of callback.
00407  * @param retval (out) optional - the first non zero value returned by eval callback, if NULL then ignored.
00408  * @param save_from_del (in) if non zero then callback can remove the current link from the list (a bit slower); if null then not; if zero then can't remove the current link from the list.
00409  * @return the list element that has matched (i.e. element that has been found).
00410  *
00411  */
00412 M_INLINE DLIST_entry * DLIST_findif( DLIST *lst, DLIST_VISITOR eval, void *context, int32_t *retval, int save_from_del)
00413 {
00414         int ret;
00415     DLIST_entry *cur, *next;
00416 
00417         if (retval) {
00418                 *retval = 0;
00419         }
00420 
00421         if (!eval) {
00422                 return 0;
00423         }
00424         
00425         if (save_from_del) {
00426                 DLIST_FOREACH_SAVE( cur, next, lst) {
00427                         ret = eval( lst, cur, context );
00428                         if (ret) {
00429                                 if (retval) {
00430                                         *retval = ret;
00431                                 }
00432                                 return cur;
00433                         }
00434                 }
00435         } else {
00436                 DLIST_FOREACH(  cur, lst ) {
00437                         ret = eval( lst, cur, context );
00438                         if (ret) {
00439                                 if (retval) {
00440                                         *retval = ret;
00441                                 }
00442                                 return cur;
00443                         }
00444                 }
00445         }               
00446 
00447         return 0;
00448 }
00449 
00450 
00451 
00452 /**
00453  * @brief find an element within the linked list. callback is invoked for each element of the list, in reverse direction from last element to first element; when the callback returns non zero value the iteration stops as we have found what we searched for. 
00454  * 
00455  * @param lst (in) the object.
00456  * @param eval (in) callback that is called to visit each set (or cleared) bit.
00457  * @param context (in) pointer that is passed as context on each invocation of callback.
00458  * @param retval (out) optional - the first non zero value returned by eval callback, if NULL then ignored.
00459  * @param save_from_del (in) if non zero then callback can remove the current link from the list (a bit slower); if null then not; if zero then can't remove the current link from the list.
00460  * @return the list element that has matched (i.e. element that has been found).
00461  *
00462  */
00463 M_INLINE DLIST_entry * DLIST_findif_reverse( DLIST *lst, DLIST_VISITOR eval, void *context, int32_t *retval, int save_from_delete)
00464 {
00465         int ret;
00466         DLIST_entry *cur, *next;
00467 
00468         if (retval) {
00469                 *retval = 0;
00470         }
00471 
00472         if (!eval) {
00473           return 0;
00474         }
00475 
00476         if ( save_from_delete ) {
00477                 DLIST_FOREACH_REVERSE_SAVE( cur, next, lst ) {
00478 
00479                         ret = eval( lst, cur, context );
00480                         if (ret) {
00481                                 if (retval) {
00482                                         *retval = ret;
00483                                 }
00484                                 return cur;
00485                         }
00486                 }
00487         } else {
00488                 DLIST_FOREACH_REVERSE( cur, lst ) {
00489 
00490                         ret = eval( lst, cur, context );
00491                         if (ret) {
00492                                 if (retval) {
00493                                         *retval = ret;
00494                                 }                               
00495                                 return cur;
00496                         }
00497                 }
00498         }
00499 
00500         return 0;
00501 }

00504 /** 
00505  * @brief iterate over all entries of the list and delete entries that match predicate from the list, and frees the memory (optionally)
00506  * @param list (in) the object.
00507  * @param check_if (in) predicate function; the function returns 1 then inspected argument element will be deleted; if argument pointer is NULL then all entries will be deleted. 
00508  * @param context (in) data pointer passed to every invocation of check_if
00509  * @param free_ctx (in) interface used to free data of entry, is argument pointer is NULL then nothing is freed.
00510  * @param offset_of_link (in) offset of DLIST_entry in embedded structure.
00511  */
00512 M_INLINE void DLIST_deleteif( DLIST *list, DLIST_VISITOR check_if, void *context,  int offset_of_link)
00513 {
00514     DLIST_entry *cur,*next,*del;
00515 
00516     DLIST_FOREACH_SAVE(cur,next,list) {
00517                 if (!check_if || check_if( list, cur, context))  {
00518                         del = DLIST_unlink( list, cur );
00519                         if (offset_of_link != -1) {
00520                           free(  _MEMBEROF( del, offset_of_link ) );
00521                         }
00522                 }
00523         }
00524 }
00525 
00526 /** 
00527  * @brief iterate over all entries of the list and delete them.
00528  * @param list (in) the object
00529 
00530  * @param on_delete(in) if not NULL then this callback is called prior to deleting each list element.
00531  * @param context (in) if on_delete is not NULL then this pointer is passed as argument to on_delete.
00532  
00533  * @param free_ctx allocation interface used to free data of entry.
00534  * @param offset_of_link offset of DLIST_entry in embedded structure.
00535  */
00536 M_INLINE void DLIST_deleteall( DLIST *list, DLIST_VISITOR_V on_delete, void *context, int offset_of_link)
00537 {
00538     DLIST_entry *cur,*next,*del;
00539 
00540     DLIST_FOREACH_SAVE(cur,next,list) {
00541                 
00542                 if (on_delete)  {                       
00543                         on_delete( list, cur, context);
00544                 }
00545 
00546                 del = DLIST_unlink( list, cur );
00547                 if (offset_of_link != -1) {
00548                   free( _MEMBEROF(del,offset_of_link) );
00549                 }
00550         }
00551 }

00554 /**
00555  * @brief insert new element into sorted list; Maintains ordering relationship between elements of linked list (sort by ascending order)
00556  * A sorting algorithm based on this function is not very efficient; it is of complexity O(n^2); nevertheless usefull if a list is modified and has to be always maintained in sorted order.
00557  * @param list (in) the object
00558  * @param compare (in) comparison function.
00559  * @param newentry (in) element that is to be inserted into list.
00560  */
00561 M_INLINE void DLIST_insert_sorted( DLIST *list, DLIST_COMPARE compare, DLIST_entry *newentry) 
00562 {
00563         DLIST_entry *cur;
00564         
00565         DLIST_FOREACH(  cur, list ) {
00566                 if (compare(cur,newentry) > 0) {
00567 
00568                         DLIST_insert_before(list, cur,newentry);
00569                         return;
00570                 }
00571         }
00572 
00573         DLIST_push_back( list, newentry );
00574 }
00575 
00576 /**
00577  * @brief Reverse a list
00578  * This function turns the first element into the last element, the second element
00579  * into the one before the last, and so on and on.
00580  * @param header (in) the object
00581  */
00582 M_INLINE void DLIST_reverse( DLIST *lst )
00583 {
00584         DLIST_entry *cur = lst->root.prev, *next;
00585         DLIST_entry *tmp;
00586         if (cur) {
00587                 next = cur->next;
00588                 cur->next = 0;
00589 
00590                 while(next) {
00591                         tmp = next->next;
00592                         
00593                         next->next = cur;
00594                         cur->prev = next;
00595 
00596                         cur = next;
00597                         next = tmp;
00598                 }
00599 
00600                 tmp = lst->root.prev;
00601                 lst->root.prev = lst->root.next;
00602                 lst->root.next = tmp;
00603         }
00604 }
00605 
00606 /**
00607  * @brief check consistency of list
00608  * @param lst list header.
00609  * @return zero if list contains errors.
00610  */
00611 M_INLINE int DLIST_check(DLIST *header)
00612 {
00613         DLIST_entry *cur,*next,*prev = 0;
00614         size_t count = 0;
00615 
00616         if (header->root.prev && !header->root.next) {
00617                 return 0;
00618         }
00619 
00620         if (header->root.prev && header->root.prev->prev) {
00621                 return 0;
00622         }
00623 
00624         if (header->root.next && header->root.next->next) {
00625                 return 0;
00626         }
00627 
00628         DLIST_FOREACH( cur, header ) {
00629 
00630                 next = cur->next;
00631                 if (next && next->prev != cur) {                
00632                         return 0;
00633                 }
00634                 if (cur->prev != prev) {
00635                         return 0;
00636                 }
00637                 count += 1;
00638                 prev = cur;
00639         }
00640 
00641         if (header->root.next != prev) {
00642                 return 0;
00643         }
00644 
00645         if (header->elmcount != count) {
00646                 return 0;
00647         }
00648         return 1;
00649 }
